intro: Picris asplenioides, commonly known as narrowleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense heads. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a common species in temperate regions, though it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
